### Homework 03 in Notepad++

## 1
```
Problem 1:

First String    Second      1.22      3.4
Second          More Text   1.555555  2.2220
Third           x           3         124


Becomes this:


First String,Second,1.22,3.4
Second,More Text,1.555555,2.2220
Third,x,3,124
```

```
My Solution:

# I used \h{2,}
# and replaced with ,
# \s{2,} put everything on one line and did not work
```

## 2
```
Problem 2:

Ballif, Bryan, University of Vermont
Ellison, Aaron, Harvard Forest
Record, Sydne, Bryn Mawr


Becomes this:


Bryan Ballif (University of Vermont)
Aaron Ellison (Harvard Forest)
Sydne Record (Bryn Mawr)
```

```
My Solution:

# I used (^\w+),(\s\w+),\s(.+$)
# and replaced with \2 \1 \(\3\)
# At first I tried \2 \1 (\3\)
# but it needs the backslash infront of (\3\)
# also tried * instead of $ but nothing would highlight/mark.
```

## 3
```
Problem 3:

0001 Georgia Horseshoe.mp3 0002 Billy In The Lowground.mp3 0003 Cherokee Shuffle.mp3 0004 Walking Cane.mp3


Becomes this:


0001 Georgia Horseshoe.mp3
0002 Billy In The Lowground.mp3
0003 Cherokee Shuffle.mp3
0004 Walking Cane.mp3
```

```
My Solution:

# I used (mp3+\s*)
# and replaced with mp3\n
```

## 4
```
Problem 4:

0001 Georgia Horseshoe.mp3
0002 Billy In The Lowground.mp3
0003 Cherokee Shuffle.mp3
0004 Walking Cane.mp3


Becomes this:


Georgia Horseshoe_0001.mp3
Billy In The Lowground_0002.mp3
Cherokee Shuffle_0003.mp3
Walking Cane_0004.mp3
```

```
My Solution:

# I used (\d{2,})\s(.*)(\..*)
# and replaced with \2_\1\3
```

## 5
```
Problem 5:

Camponotus,pennsylvanicus,10.2,44
Camponotus,herculeanus,10.5,3
Myrmica,punctiventris,12.2,4
Lasius,neoniger,3.3,55


Becomes this:


C_pennsylvanicus,44
C_herculeanus,3
M_punctiventris,4
L_neoniger,55
```

```
My Solution:

# I used (\w)\w*\,(\w*)(\,)\d{1,}\.\d{1,}\,
# and replaced with \1_\2\3
```
## 6
```
Problem 6:

Camponotus,pennsylvanicus,10.2,44
Camponotus,herculeanus,10.5,3
Myrmica,punctiventris,12.2,4
Lasius,neoniger,3.3,55


Becomes this:


C_penn,44
C_herc,3
M_punc,4
L_neon,55
```

```
My Solution:

# I used (\w)\w*\,(\w{4})\w*(\,)\d{1,}\.\d{1,}\,
# and replaced with \1_\2\3
```
## 7
```
Problem 7:

Camponotus,pennsylvanicus,10.2,44
Camponotus,herculeanus,10.5,3
Myrmica,punctiventris,12.2,4
Lasius,neoniger,3.3,55


Becomes this:


Campen, 44, 10.2
Camher, 3, 10.5
Myrpun, 4, 12.2
Lasneo, 55, 3.3
```

```
My Solution:

# I used (\w{3})\w*\,(\w{3})\w*(\,)(\d*\.\d*)(\,)(\d*)
# and replaced with \1\2\5 \6\5 \4
# Saved too many commas, hence \3 is not in use
```
